string-array.name: focus
string-array.item: A 160-hp 2.0-liter four-cylinder is standard but a 123-hp 1.0-liter turbo three-cylinder with auto start-stop is optional for extra efficiency. A six-speed dual-clutch automatic is available but we prefer the five-speed manual. A handsome exterior and functional interior with a load of standard and available features win the Focus extra style points.

string-array.name: fusion
string-array.item: The base engine is a 175-hp 2.5-liter four, but optional 181-hp 1.5-liter or 240-hp 2.0-liter turbo fours aim to provide a little extra zip. All are mated to a six-speed automatic with front or all-wheel drive. Two hybrid models are available, both with a 2.0-liter four paired with an electric motor for a combined 188 hp; the plug-in model offers a 19-mile electric-only range.

string-array.name: mustang
string-array.item: A 300-hp 3.7-liter V-6, a 310-hp 2.3-liter turbo four-cylinder, and a 435-hp 5.0-liter V-8 are all offered with a six-speed manual or six-speed automatic. An independent rear suspension improves its ride and provides better cornering. In either coupe or convertible form, the Mustang appeals without compromising its heritage.
